review: The Good: Has enough memory and processing power to run Netflix and Amazon streaming content without issue.  Small form factor and remote with excellent voice search.  The Bad:  Malfunctioning less than six months after purchase (locks up and fails to power down automatically).  User has no ability to power down device without unplugging it.Update:  A software update seems to have resolved the issues my device was having and Amazon has also included a way to power down the device by holding down the home button on the remote.  So I'm updating my review to 4 stars.

review: Fairly lame device. It's very speed, the hardware specs are very impressive. But using the arrows on the remote sucks. It often registers multiple clicks and suddenly I scroll across 5 tiles when I just meant to go 1 tile to the right. The voice search feature does not work with anything except Amazon. If you say "House of Cards" into your remote, it takes you to where you can buy it on Amazon Prime, even if you already have Netflix installed, subscribed, and running in the foreground. You can't even watch YouTube or Chromecast to this thing. I was hoping it'd be intuitive enough to get one for my parents. I was not impressed.
author: Phillip

review: Love it. Love Amazon Prime!  I use it to watch movies and some TV series. It beats cable by far and allows me to watch what I want, when I want. I have cancelled my cable TV and saved hundreds of dollars a year. Easy to use, works great. Does what it claims without taking up any room, (mine is mounted to the back of my TV and works great.)  Does everything I need. Highly recommend it.!
author: Don
